description: Managed the asset validation program by providing guidance, oversight and evaluation. Developed policy, procedures, and reporting requirements to ensure asset validation processes were streamlined, efficient, and in compliance with regulatory requirements. Responsible for integrating asset validation results into operational evaluations, through synthesis, analysis, and interrelating of meaningful data, that facilitated the issuance of operational approval. . Served as senior Agency representative for issues related to asset validation, and lead ad hoc teams to plan and develop strategies. Maintained operational coordination with relevant federal agencies.

description: Ensured theater and national information requirements were expeditiously processed and acted upon. Coordinated with DIA Operational Directorate (DIA/DO), OSD, EUCOM and AFRICOM as required to obtain operational support and to coordinate activities. Briefed and updated EUCOM J2 as required. Maintained situational awareness of current and planned DIA/DO activities in the EUCOM/AFRICOM areas of responsibility. Coordinated and staffed Senior Defense Officer/Defense Attaché (SDO/DATT) nomination packages with the relevant command. Deployed to Afghanistan (08/2008-02/2009) in support of Operation Enduring Freedom as a reports officer for DIA/DO support to the Counterterrorism Task Force (TF 373).

description: Served at Forward Operating Base-Europe (FOB-E) Detachment Stuttgart, producing and disseminating reports in response to standing and ad-hoc information requirements in the EUCOM theater. Primary EUCOM senior staff debriefer. Spearheaded support efforts to debrief General and Flag Officers returning from trips in the EUCOM area of responsibility. Efforts greatly facilitated access to the Deputy Commander, the J2 and other flag officers. As Acting Detachment Chief, led and managed activities of a 10-person operational element. Was responsible for all activities, personnel management of civilian and military personnel, oversight, and fiscal management of detachment’s budget and property. Deployed to Iraq (11/2004-05/2005) in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom, as the chief of a special activity at Operating Base Iraq – Detachment Camp Slayer.

description: nit and target-based operations manager and expert for US Defense Attaché Offices (USDAOs) in Latin-America. Represented DIA/DO in interagency meetings and maintained liaison with DIA and Military Services analysts. Developed DIA Operating Directives supporting National Needs and coordinated them through U.S. Defense and Command representatives for proper assignation to field units. Monitored, focused and evaluated USDAO reporting efforts. Actively coordinated with interagency analysts to obtain assessments of the value of activities and information. Coordinated and validated information requirements for proper tasking. Prepared background and information papers for presentation by me and others to Congressional Delegations traveling to Latin America. Briefed outgoing U.S. Ambassadors to the region. Translated briefings from English into Spanish to be presented to high-level Latin American military personnel visiting DIA/DO. Deployed in support of DIA/DO efforts in the Global War on Terrorism to Guantanamo Naval Base Cuba for three months, serving as the Reports Officer, Collection Manager and Desk Officer for a 29-person unit assigned to JTF-170.

description: Served as Assistant DIA Officer for Latin America in the Directorate for Policy Support. Produced numerous papers for the DIA Command Element in support of meetings with senior foreign and U.S. officials. Provided support to senior OSD policymakers. Provided daily briefings to the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Special Operations and Low Intensity Conflict Inter-American Affairs (DASD/SOLIC-IA) regarding developments in the Latin American region and their implications for Department of Defense interests. Orchestrated numerous background papers and led briefings by DIA analytical elements in support of requirements from the Assistant Secretary of Defense for SOLIC, PDASD/SOLIC-IA, and DASD/SOLIC-Peacekeeping Humanitarian Assistance. Participated in numerous actions to include coordination of DIA and interagency products, the review of National Operational Directives, the briefing of senior foreign officers, and the review of documents for public disclosure.

description: Managed support to Combat Command and Service exercises for the DIA Directorate for Operations (DO), to include exercise coordination, planning and DO representation. DIA/DO liaison to the Joint Chiefs of Staff Exercise Program. Interacted with the Joint Staff, Office of the Secretary of Defense, Combatant Commands, JCS/J2, the Services, and other major Commands. Developed and produced DIA/DO annexes for CJCS exercises. Assisted DIADO Divisions in the planning, coordinating and validating of DO support to the Unified Command Operational and Contingency Plan Annexes. Represented the DO in exercise planning and coordination, and acted as the DO during exercises replicating the National Support Teams and J2X concepts (South Korea and Panama). Managed the DO budget account for exercises. Advised and assisted DIA SupportElements in coordinating DO support to Command’s Joint Task Forces, theater plans and architecture. Managed DO personnel deployment training requirements.

description: Detailed from a DIA Operational Detachment in Suitland Maryland from December 1995 to December 1996 to DIA Directorate for Operations Headquarters in Arlington, Virginia, to serve as a watch officer for operations and communications. In that capacity, I provided worldwide crisis situation/events information to senior leadership. I coordinated operational tasking between field elements, DO Headquarters and JCS/J2 during the Balkans crisis, and later on to include worldwide current events. Prepared daily situation briefings for the Director of Operations. As a civilian member of a US Naval Task Force unit based in Panama, supported U.S. Special Forces units stationed in the former Panama Canal Zone. Participated in a four-month project involving a multinational naval training exercise around Latin American ports. Managed a US Navy program involving the security of cruise ships transiting the Panama Canal. Served as a periodic officer-in-charge of a remote two-person maritime detachment. Responsible for the coordination of counter drug requirements and support with SOUTHCOM, US Army South, Defense Attaché Offices in Latin America, and counter drug agencies. Conducted liaison with Defense Attaché Offices in Latin America, local special warfare/boat units, and analysts from DOD, USN and US Southern Command (USSOUTHCOM). Managed the office budget program. Detailed for four months to the Plans, Programs, Budget, and Requirements Directorate for a US Navy office at the Pentagon, to support the preparation of fiscal programs and the Navy input to the DoD Aspin Commission Report.
